ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about how to conduct and execute an original research project.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths - flexibility, teaching staff; weaknesses - sometimes the direction wasn't very clear

The progress checks, opportunities to ask questions, and skill-building workshops (librarian and IRB visits) were excellent uses of our limited class time. I felt well-supported and appreciated the structure this class provided to ensure I made progress this semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, i would recommend this class to students majoring in sociology. its a great opportunity to invest time into a project that really matters to you
Yes, if you're interested in conducting original research and are prepared to dedicate time throughout the whole year to do it well.
